facts: Texas company sold one product to a Florida resident at a trade show in Georgia
Product caused injury to Florida resident in Florida
Texas company has no office, employees, or sales in Florida
Texas company does not advertise in Florida
Lawsuit filed in Florida state court
asp_facts: claim(c1). claim_type(c1, personal_jurisdiction). plaintiff(c1, fl_resident). defendant(c1, tx_company). forum_state(c1, florida). minimum_contacts(c1, no). purposeful_availment(c1, no). relatedness(c1, yes). specific_jurisdiction(c1, no). general_jurisdiction(c1, no).
question: Does Florida have personal jurisdiction over the Texas company?
rationale: The Texas company lacks minimum contacts with Florida. A single sale at an out-of-state trade show does not constitute purposeful availment of Florida's market. The company has no systematic and continuous contacts for general jurisdiction.
